meanings.definition: The study of the causes or origins of diseases.
meanings.sent1: Doctors use etiology to understand why diseases start.
meanings.sent2: The etiology of cancer is complex and involves many factors.
meanings.sent3: The detective's etiology of the mysterious illness led to a surprising revelation.
meanings.sent4: In the etiology of health issues, stress often plays a significant role.
meanings.sent5: Learning about etiology helps researchers prevent diseases from spreading.

meanings.definition: The cause or origin of a disease or condition.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the etiology of a virus is crucial for developing treatments.
meanings.sent2: The etiology of the flu can be traced back to specific strains of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The etiology of his constant sneezing turned out to be an allergy to cats.
meanings.sent4: In the etiology of heart disease, genetics can play a significant role.
meanings.sent5: Identifying the etiology of a problem is the first step towards finding a solution.
